content: The difference between being alone and being lonely: one is a choice, the other is an ache.
Reading old journals is like meeting a stranger who shares all your memories but none of your current concerns.
Perhaps the point of keeping a commonplace book is not to preserve ideas but to cultivate a certain quality of attention.
On revision: Not fixing what's broken, but discovering what you meant to say all along.
The best writing advice: Read. Then read more. Then write. Then read what you wrote as if a stranger wrote it.
